Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a Santa Clara Valley vineyard offers generous aroma of strawberry pie, nutmeg and more baking spices in the deliciously rich nose. There's a brief hit of tannic grip at the tip of the sip, which opens into ripe cherry and space cake flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Storrs 2019 Grenache (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A lighter, rusty, almost browning color in the glass, this is a complex bottling that grows more interesting with time. Aromas of dried cherry and white pepper drop into a cranberry, rose petal and cinnamon palate, which is wrapped in a leathery grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kings Carey 2019 Spear Vineyards Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This well-concentrated wine made with native yeast and aged in neutral barrels offers buoyant strawberry and red-plum flavors backed by light tannins and a good, smoky, black-peppery undertone. It is complex, full bodied and ready to enjoy through 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathis 2019 Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An intensely dark hue in the glass, this bottling from an epic vineyard is jam-packed with spice, offering gingerbread, clove and nutmeg against the berry fruit aromas. The spice is front-and-center on the palate as well, where firm tannins uphold the baked berry fruit elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chiron Wines 2018 Unfamiliar Truth Slide Hill Vineyard Grenache (Edna Valley)

Description: This is a solid example of how cool-climate Grenache shows tremendous intensity rather than going light from ocean influence. Aromas of concentrated plum, graphite, cocoa and latte show on the nose, while the palate, which is wrapped in thicker tannins, unleashes undulating waves of baked fruit, cocoa dust and loamy soil. The pie crust spice adds an approachable finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Optio 2020 GrenacheEditors' Choice

Description: The generous palate of this full-bodied wine is enjoyable now, with notes of fresh figs, raspberries, plums, wild berries, thyme and violets. Grown on cooler parcels, this Grenache is pure and elegant. This beautiful bottling will be hard to stay away from, but cellaring through 2028 to 2030 will reward those who can possibly wait.                      Anna-Christina Cabrales
Name: Domaine des Bosquets 2019 Le Lieu Dit  (Gigondas)
